title: Red Sox Crush Yankees, Win 5th Straight - NYSE Post
text:
Red Sox Crush Yankees, Win 5th Straight Oct 10 2015 
He gave up seven runs in six innings, the eighth time this season he has coughed up five runs or more in a start. 
All the complicated equations for the Yankees' postseason clinching, all the talk about when to spray champagne, were quickly muted during Tuesday's top of the first inning. 
Pitching coach Carl Willis came to the mound at that point and was direct with Porcello. 
Darin Ruf connected on a three-run home run in the first inning and the bullpen worked 4 1/3 effective innings to lead Philadelphia, which is looking to avoid its first 100-loss season since 1961 (47-107). After Dustin Ackley's two-run homer made it 6-4 in the first, Porcello allowed just two hits over the next seven innings - and one of them was an infield single. Carlos Beltran hit an RBI double, and Dustin Ackley had a two-run homer.

"And I was thinking, That's going to track back a little further, and it got lost in the stadium lights and I was like, Oh shit, that's coming right at me ". 
With his father and brother among dozens of supporters in the stands, Rick Porcello certainly didn't want to get knocked out in the first inning.

Porcello rebounded with a strikeout of Chase Headley ending the inning. The next day's first inning by the Yankees was even more impressive as they had four hits and scored four runs.
The Sox tacked on a seventh run to lead off the fifth on a home run by Betts, and Swihart put it away with another homer, this one a two-run blast to right against Bryan Mitchell.
